page.title: 18RELIGION:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: Both parishes are in Norwich Diocese & the Depwade Deanery.Bedingham St And- rews church being 1 of 8 in the Hemp- nall Group of parishes,& the parish in 1985 celebrated its 21 years in the group with Woodton,Hempnall,Topcroft, Fritton,Morningthorpe,Shelton & Hard- wick.It had been linked with Woodton since 1926.The Group is staffed by a rector,vicar & a non-stipendiary,who live within the group tho' not in Bed- ingham. Hedenham St Peter's Anglican church is served,together with Broome & Ditchingham,by 1 rector living in the latter parish.Woodton's 1841 Meth- odist chapel is part of a circuit with the United Reformed Church, administ- ered from Bungay & served by 1 full- time minister & a supernumerary. Bed- ingham people are almost all Angli- cans,Hedenham's also but with a few Catholics who attend mass in Bungay.
